text.p: Chateau Properties Inc said Friday its board began to consider the unsolicited proposals received recently from Sun Communities Inc and Manufactured Home Communities Inc.
Chateau Properties previously signed a definitive agreement and plan of merger with ROC Communities Inc.
Chateau Properties, a real estate investment trust, on August 21 received an unsolicited, $372 million stock offer from Sun Communities.

On August 19, Chateau received a $387 million cash offer from Manufactured Home, which is controlled by investor Samuel Zell. Zell also offered the option of a stock deal that would be worth $316 million based on the current stock price of Manufactured Home, or a combination of cash and stock.
Chateau said recently its agreement with ROC provides for the strategic combination of the two companies.

Under that agreement, announced in July, ROC shareholders would receive 1.042 shares of the new company's stock for each ROC share held. Chateau hareholders would receive one share of the new company's stock for each share held.
